2163.subject: BUS
2163.descrlong:
Emphasizes the entrepreneur/manager raising funds at minimal cost and risk, and the allocation of those funds to increase shareholders' wealth and company value. Encompasses financial statements, time value of money, bond/stock valuation, cost of capital, and related subjects. Develops both the skills and ability to understand the impact of financial decision making to business and its stakeholders. Stresses ethical financial reporting. (Offered every semester.)

[Prereq: (BUS 203 or Financial Accounting)  and (BUS 205 or Managerial Accounting) and (Upper Division Standing)]
